sen.j: 不破内親王（ふわないしんのう、723年（養老7年）頃 - 795年（延暦14年）頃）は奈良時代の皇族。
sen.e: Imperial Princess Fuwa (around 723 - around 795) was a member of the Imperial Family in the Nara period.

sen.e: Imperial Princess Fuwa (around 723 - around 795) was a member of the imperial family in the Nara period.

sen.j: 父は聖武天皇、母は夫人県犬養広刀自。
sen.e: Her father was the Emperor Shomu and her mother was fujin (consort of the emperor) Agata no inukai no hirotoji.
Her father was Emperor Shomu and her mother was fujin (consort of the emperor) Agata no inukai no hirotoji.

sen.j: 同母姉に井上内親王、同母弟に安積親王がいる。
sen.e: Her older maternal half-sister was Imperial Princess Inoe and her younger maternal half-brother was Prince Asaka.
Her older maternal half-sister was Imperial Princess Inoe and her younger maternal half-brother was Prince Asaka.
Her older maternal half-sister was Imperial Princess Inoe and her younger maternal half-brother was Prince Asaka.

sen.j: 739年頃、天武天皇の孫で新田部親王の子である塩焼王に嫁ぎ、氷上志計志麻呂・氷上川継の二人の息子を産む（ただし、一部には両者を同一人物とする説もある）。
sen.e: Around 739, she married Prince Shioyaki who was a grandchild of the Emperor Tenmu and a child of Imperial Prince Niitabe and gave birth to two sons HIKAMI no Shikeshimaro and HIKAMI no Kawatsugu (however, another theory holds that both were the same person).

Around 739. she married Emperor Tenmu's grandson and Imperial Prince Niitabe's son Prince Shioyaki, and gave birth to two sons HIKANI no Shikeshimaro and HIKAMI no Kawatsugu (however, there is a theory that both are the same person).
sen.cmt: 表現をより簡潔にしました。
sen.e: Around 739. she married Emperor Tenmu's grandson and Imperial Prince Niitabe's son Prince Shioyaki, and gave birth to two sons HIKANI no Shikeshimaro and HIKAMI no Kawatsugu (however, there is a theory that both are the same person).

sen.j: 764年に夫は藤原仲麻呂の乱に加わったとして処刑される。
sen.e: In 764, her husband was executed for joining in FUJIWARA no Nakamaro's War.
In 764 her husband was executed for joining in FUJIWARA no Nakamaro's War.
sen.cmt: コンマを削除しました。

sen.j: 769年、県犬養姉女、忍坂女王、石田女王らと共に孝謙天皇を呪詛し、息子の志計志麻呂を皇位に就けようとしたとして、厨真人厨女と名を改名された。
sen.e: In 769, her name was changed to Kuriya no mahito kuriyame for cursing the Empress Koken in conspiracy with Agata no inukai no aneme, Oshisaka no himemiko, Ishida no himemiko and others and for trying to propel her son Shikeshimaro to the Imperial Throne.

sen.j: その上、平城京から追放され、志計志麻呂は土佐国に流罪となる。
sen.e: Moreover, she was banished from Heijo-kyo (the ancient capital of Japan in current Nara) and Shikeshimaro was deported to Tosa Province.

sen.j: 771年にそれが冤罪だったと判明し、帰京する。
sen.e: In 771, it was discovered that she has been falsely charged and she returned to the capital.

sen.j: 782年、息子の川継が謀反を起こして伊豆国に流されたのに連座し、不破内親王も淡路国へ流される（氷上川継の乱）。
sen.e: In 782, in connection with that her son Kawatsugu raised a rebellion and he was banished to Izu Province, Imperial Princess Fuwa was also banished to Awaji Province (HIKAMI no Kawatsugu's War).
In 782 Imperial Princess Fuwa was banished to Awaji Province in connection with her son Kawatsugu who had been banished to Izu Province for starting a rebellion (HIKAMI no Kawatsugu's War).
sen.cmt: コンマを削除しました。 より自然な表現に修正しました。
sen.e: In 782 Imperial Princess Fuwa was banished to Awaji Province in connection with her son Kawatsugu who had been banished to Izu Province for starting a rebellion (HIKAMI no Kawatsugu's War).

sen.j: その13年後の795年、淡路から和泉国に移されたのを最後に、史料上での消息が途切れる事から、この頃に亡くなったものと思われる。
sen.e: 13 years later in 795, she was moved from Awaji to Izumi Province and thereafter there was no description about her in historical materials, thereby she was believed to die at that time.
Due to the fact that there is no further mention of her in historical materials after being moved from Awaji to Izumi Province 13 years later in 795, it is believed she died around this time.

sen.j: 死後、現在の千葉県印旛郡印旛村にある、松虫寺に遺骨を納めたという言い伝えがある。
sen.e: There is a tradition that, after her death, her ashes were buried in Matsumushi-dera Temple in present Imba-mura, Imba-gun, Chiba Prefecture.
There is a legend that after her death, her remains were buried in Matsumushi-dera Temple in present Imba Village, Imba County, Chiba Prefecture.

sen.j: また、この松虫寺については、次のような言い伝えがある。
sen.e: In addition, for the Matsumushi-dera Temple, there is a tradition as follows.
In addition, there is a legend regarding Matsumushi-dera Temple.

sen.j: 不破内親王がらい病を患ってしまった際、夢の中に現れた薬師如来のお告げにより、下総国へ出向いた。
sen.e: When Imperial Princess Fuwa suffered from leper, she had a revelation from Yakushi Nyorai (the Healing Buddha) in her dream and went to Shimousa Province.
When Imperial Princess Fuwa suffered from leprosy, she had a revelation from Yakushi Nyorai (the Healing Buddha) in her dream and went to Shimousa Province.

sen.j: そして印旛地方のある寺に、夢に現れた薬師如来があったという。
sen.e: It was said that Yakushi Nyorai appeared in her dream was placed in a temple in Imba region.
It is said that Yakushi Nyorai who had appeared in her dream was in a temple in Imba region.

sen.j: 内親王はそこで療養をしたところ、回復した。
sen.e: Imperial Princess received medical treatment there and she recovered.
The imperial princess received medical treatment there and she recovered.

sen.j: 聖武天皇はそれを喜び、その薬師如来がある寺を改築して、松虫寺とした。
sen.e: The Emperor Shomu was glad at her recovery and rebuilt the temple where Yakushi Nyorai was placed to name it Matsumushi-dera Temple.
